positions.title: Site Reliability Engineer
positions.description: Automate everything. Build quality, highly reliable, and scalable, cloud native services. Focus on AWS/GCP and serverless (lambda/functions). NodeJS, Go, Python, bash, and OCaml/ReasonML. Spark, scikit-learn, caffe, Terraform, Packer, Consul, Docker, rkt, and kubernetes. Prometheus, ElasticSearch + Kibana, Grafana, Sematext. GitHub, Jenkins, Spinnaker, CodeBuild/CodeDeploy. nginx, React / Apollo -> GraphQL

positions.title: Managing Architect - MSS R&D
positions.description: As Managing Architect in R&D, my focus is on leading a DevOps team to build and maintain the automation of R&D's infrastructure. My focus is on building the automation and elasticity of our infrastructure, migration to cloud, and transition to micro-services to support cloud native application development. Our team manages the code build pipeline, container and system management, deployment, monitoring, testing, and everything else DevOps related. Our goal is to build security related applications as micro-services that can scale up and scale down as necessary in a cloud-native environment. The outcome is that we save costs for the business, maintain maximum availability for our internal and external customers, and efficiently utilize resources with on-demand infrastructure to support our internal and external APIs, big data analytics, and machine learning.

positions.title: Solutions Architect
positions.description: Work with Account Managers throughout the selling process by participating in business development calls. Assist Account Managers in selling established contracts and developing relationships with prospects. Manage the proposal process and create SOW’s and RFP’s. Coordinate follow-up sales activities (i.e. evaluation, implementation, customer training). Maintain relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance as well as research and recommend new solutions and services. Obtain and maintain top tier vendor certification.

positions.title: Security Architect
positions.description: Scope and complete the implementation of RiskIQ solutions, at customer sites and remotely. Meet with customers, gather both product and integration requirements, and be able to demonstrate and explain the various aspects of the RiskIQ solutions. Architect customer workflows, processes, and documentation. Interact with customers in a collaborative, consultative manner to deliver results, provide feedback and make recommendations. Independently decompose and solve complex client problems with very little direction. Leverage the RiskIQ tool to deliver intelligence reports on emerging threats. Deliver world-class “white glove” customer enablement and customer support. Architect and implement integrations of the RiskIQ solutions at the client site – e.g. integrate with SIEM or GRC tools, customer dashboards, and next-generation intelligence tools (e.g. Palantir). Develop add-ons to the RiskIQ APIs to solve customer needs. Research emerging security topics and new attack vectors, in both the web and mobile spaces. Publish and present your work to RiskIQ subscribers, and to the world at large

positions.title: Technical Account Manager
positions.description: As Technical Account Manager I work with targeted client accounts. I aggressively own and drive projects from inception to completion, identify and document project requirements, support clients on various information security initiatives, keep all stakeholders apprised of project and budget status, and manage issues to resolution. I am also responsible for assembling project teams, assigning individual responsibilities, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedule to ensure timely completion of project and issues. Some of my responsibilities include: Independently lead projects from inception to completion. Build and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Ensure alignment between demand and capacity. Effectively delegate and ensure timely completion of all open tickets with client Lead information security projects from inception to completion. Identify and assess project risk. Build appropriate mitigation plans into the overall project initiatives. Develop a project plan detailing schedules, controls, resources, costs and daily tasks. Assure overall project and service offering quality and consistency. Validate, manage and control the scope of the offering and of the project. Meet regularly with team to aid in identifying issues and strategies. Actively monitor project budget, deliverables and open tickets. Consolidate and report project performance and metrics. Coordinate and manage projects across various functional groups, communicating impacts. Establish communication plans to facilitate core project team coordination and to provide status to management and extended project team members. Effectively negotiate with customers, stakeholders, coworkers and 3rd parties. Manage projects to quality and profitability standards. Implement project management controls to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations

positions.title: Sr Managed Security Services Engineer
positions.description: Responsible for leading the integration and implementation of security devices and products that enable delivery of managed security services into a variety of simple to complex network environments. Manage all aspects of the integration process for Managed Security Services; including network and security design review and recommendations, technical data gathering, security and policy review and configuration, troubleshooting, coordination of equipment and system staging, configuration, installation, and activation of services for delivery by the Security Operations Center. In-depth knowledge of TCP/IP networking and routing communication protocols, as well as hands on experience and in-depth knowledge, understanding and a strong competency in best-of-breed Firewall and IDS/IPS security products (CheckPoint, Cisco, Juniper, SourceFire, Palo Alto). Review and provide consulting to customers on their security and architectural design. Responsible for multi-vendor/multi-device/platform implementations with geographically dispersed customers, partners and/or other service providers. Lead troubleshooting efforts for complex network environments to identify and eliminate network or security configuration issues.

blurb.heading: About Me
blurb.text:
I'm a highly motivated self starter with an obsession for learning new things.
I jumped from 8th grade into college full time (skipping high school altogether), but left before completing my degree to focus on developing and learning through my career.
I started with programming in C++ and Linux systems administration, pivoted to networking, moved on to information security for ~7-8 years, and finally landed in DevOps. My passions right now are functional programming (Haskell, OCaml, ReasonML, and dare I say... JavaScript?), cloud, microservices through containerization/serverless/unikernels, continuous delivery by way of automation, and Everything-as-Code.
I've accumulated a massive breadth of knowledge and experience across networking, information security (network security, application security, and system security), incident response, compliance, cloud, applications and systems architecture, etc..
I've worked in network/security operations, management (led a team of 14), security architecture, sales (as a Solutions Architect), and led a DevOps team within an R&D organization. I'm at a startup currently, leading our effort to build a solid continuous delivery pipeline as a Site Reliability Engineer. My focus right now is on designing/building/scaling our cloud environment via microservices, continuous delivery pipeline, and developing a platform focused on machine learning. Occasionally, I also assist our professional services team as an SME in InfoSec and DevOps practices.
